items.title: New Commute Vehicle
items.content_html:
After much deliberation on a commute vehicle replacement for the motorcycle (lots of reasons there‚Ä¶), the Tesla M3 came out as the winner as not only the most cost effective means of travel, but the most fun to drive.

I placed an order on Thursday. Delivery slated for Monday! Now‚Ä¶ to figure out how to get to work on Monday‚Ä¶ I think a rental car is the best option. ü§î Heh, or I could two back with my Jeep. ü§£

Hmm‚Ä¶ I also need to get a wall charger installed at home pronto!
Nearly spilled coffee all over my work MacBook Pro. üò±

I test drove a Model 3 today‚Ä¶ so much I thought I wouldn‚Äôt like going into it, but I actually really liked everything about it. White interior was also my favorite over the black.

And holy crap, the performance model is fast!

At 17mpg, my Jeep makes a terrible commuter.

The best options I‚Äôm looking at are the ‚Äò15 BMW 328d and ‚Äò15 Audi 3 TDI, both about 45 mpg. Even factoring in vehicle cost, I‚Äôm looking at a savings of $2500+ per year. A Model 3 is only an effective saving of $1300 (new car $$$).

I sometimes get far too angry about programming annoyances. Latest example:

private var session: URLSession? = nil

Simple, but no‚Ä¶ I need to do this:

private var session: URLSession?

public init(session: URLSession? = nil) {
    self.session = session
}
I guess it‚Äôs time to retire my iPhone SE - its been fun, but back to the giant phones I suppose. iPhone Xs ordered.

Ah. No more boiler-plate! I hate boiler-plate. Test infra is now all completely generated for my little pet project.

‚ûú  proteus git:(master) ‚úó make test
mkdir -p bin/generated
python ./scripts/generate-tests.py -p ../../ --test-dir tests -o bin/generated/tests.c -i protc/libs.h -i protc/lexer.c -i tests/testlib.h
mkdir -p bin
clang -Wall -gmodules bin/generated/tests.c -o bin/protc_tests
bin/protc_tests
‚Ä° tests from bin/generated/tests.c
  ‚úì test_minimal_func_decl
  ‚úì test_minimal_func_decl_with_return_type
  ‚úì test_minimal_func_decl_with_return_type_and_crazy_spacing

¬ß test status (3 of 3) passed.
Some days it seems like I‚Äôm just spending a bunch of time trying to figure out the least hacky way to do something‚Ä¶

items.title: More Customer Service Fun
items.content_html:
This time, it‚Äôs with Microsoft. As some of my previous thoughts (that‚Äôs what I‚Äôm calling micro.blog posts üòè) talked about: I upgraded my daughter‚Äôs computer due to some case re-arrangments. In th process, I also upgraded my computer to a Ryzen 5 2600X and a new motherboard.

Of course, Windows was not happy. I couldn‚Äôt get the activation to work, even though I have a valid Win 10 Pro key purchased from the Microsoft Alumni web store.

So‚Ä¶ I called customer support thinking, na√Øvely it turns out, that it would be much better than my IKEA ordeal (oh, and apparently is magically resolved today - we‚Äôll see).

The first rep, which I got in contact with in only a few moments (looking good so far!). Well, this person tried to help me, but since I was getting the dreaded 0xC004E003, they couldn‚Äôt help me and needed to transfer me to the store.

OK, no worries‚Ä¶ except they transferred me to a brick-n-mortar Microsoft store. Ugh? This lady was all confused and obviously couldn‚Äôt help me with my problem.

So I call back, run through all of the same steps, and the tech couldn‚Äôt help me. Says he will transfer me to another tech.

‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶

Like 30 minutes later on hold, still crickets.

At this point, it‚Äôs just better for my health at this point to pay the $40 to buy a new license, as stupid as that is. ü§¶üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

May your customer service adventures be more pleasant then mine have been lately.
I think something is wrong with me‚Ä¶ I like writing parsers. ü§î
Oh my‚Ä¶ I just got a random call tonight confirming my delivery for my IKEA furniture I ordered. It must have been found!
Of course all of IKEA‚Äôs customer support ‚Äúcircuits are busy‚Äù‚Ä¶ the pain keeps coming.

items.title: Why is this so hard!?
items.content_html:
This is beyond ridiculous and just terrible customer service.

Just a brief summary for the fun experience I‚Äôve had trying to order a desk from IKEA (I‚Äôve ordered before with no issues‚Ä¶):

  • Ordered a desk on 8/2.
  • Original delivery scheduled for 8/11
  • Attempt to call multiple times to re-schedule for 8/18
  • Shipping calls for delivery, finally updated to 8/18
  • Call for window between 1-4 on 8/18
  • No delivery
  • Call shipping company (multiple times throughout the week), they don‚Äôt know where the package is and they have no response from their ‚Äúdock search‚Äù, even with ‚Äúmanagement involved‚Äù (this is T-Force)
  • Multiple calls to IKEA, which has the worst phone system ever‚Ä¶ either busy, or you get through to a few menus deep and are told about ‚ÄúUnexpected high call volume‚Äù and hung-up on. I‚Äôve called multiple times throughout multiple weeks‚Ä¶ this doesn‚Äôt seem like ‚Äúunexpected high call volume‚Äù; seems normal.
  • Finally get to talk to an IKEA customer service rep after 45 minutes on hold. Says, ‚Äúoh, this is easy to fix‚Äù‚Ä¶ moments later, he transfers me to the shipping company, that is closed. ü§¨ü§¨ü§¨ü§¨
  • FIll out online form to cancel order, no response after 4 days.

So, my options seem to be:

  • Continue to wait, irrationally, for my package to be found
  • Continue to waste time on trying to actually get in contact with someone at IKEA‚Äôs customer service department
  • Go into IKEA the when I‚Äôm up in the office for work, wasting more time to try and get this resolved - of course, since it‚Äôs an online order, they are probably going to be unlikely to have the ability to help me
  • Dispute the charge with the credit card company

All I wanted was a desk for my wife‚Äôs computer‚Ä¶ üò≠
I got to ride my bike into work today for the first time in about three weeks: it was nice. =)

I hate graphs like this; they provide no actual information and are clearly meant to tell a story that the author wants you to see instead of providing actual information that you can understands based on facts.

This whole RTX launch seems super sketchy to me.

After switching cases with my daughter, I got downgraded to a Ryzen 2200. I tried to suffer with huge mid-tower and ATX motherboard and only get a 2600x and 1060 replacement card for me.

Now, I have a new case, ITX MB, and Noctua cooling setup coming this weekend.

¬Ø_(„ÉÑ)_/¬Ø
Unit Testing Doesn‚Äôt Need to be Involved: owensd.io/2018/08/2‚Ä¶
30 minutes until my D&D session‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs enough time to write some code‚Ä¶

The RTX 20* series looks pretty interesting, but my guess is they offer little, if any, gain over the current GTX 10* series in terms of FPS for games not specifically built for the architecture, and even then, it looks like it‚Äôs going to be a quality boost.

Need some reviews!

I‚Äôm currently using the hosted micro.blog service, but that still goes against the spirit of owensd.micro.blog/2018/08/1‚Ä¶ I‚Äôd really like to set it up so that I can post and aggregrate everything from my own setup, but that requires so much time‚Ä¶

I swapped my CPU and graphics card out with my daughter‚Äôs PC so she could have a smaller case to fit on her small desk. BUT now my computer won‚Äôt really work because the video card cooler fan (hijacked from an eGPU enclosure) hits the CMOS battery. ü§¶üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

I‚Äôve been looking at a photo editing computer for my wife the past few weeks. I went back and forth all over the spectrum (iMac, MBP, PC, Hackintosh). Decided on the 15‚Äù MacBook Pro as it allows us to progressively dive deeper with an external display and an eGPU.
Ah, now this is looking much better. Nether with it‚Äôs annoying plug though. üò†
This is just ridiculous. I have nearly three feet of extra coax length here. Hopefully I can shove it up into the wall.

IKEA desk comes tomorrow. Still debating on a 13‚Äù MacBook Pro + external display or just canabilizing my gaming PC for my wife‚Äôs new photo editing/managing station. And potentially switching it over to an Intel platform. ü§î
